clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Targeted Nutrient Supplementation on Physical Activity and Healthy Related Quality of Life in Advanced COPD

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective is to investigate the efficacy of targeted nutrient supplementation on daily physical activity level as well as generic health status in patients with advanced COPD. Additionally the investigators aim to investigate the relative effect of targeted nutrient supplementation on the recovery after hospitalization for a COPD exacerbation. The secondary objective is to investigate the effect of targeted nutrient supplementation on mental health, physical performance, blood markers, patient related outcomes and gut health.

detailed_description.textblock:
Rationale: Impaired physical and mental health are common features in advanced COPD adversely affecting disease course and quality of life. Furthermore, nutritional status is often impaired due to dietary and plasma nutrient deficiencies, decreased muscle oxidative metabolism and impaired intestinal permeability. The investigators hypothesize that targeted nutrient supplementation can lead to gut-muscle-brain axis-mediated amelioration of physical, cognitive and mental health domains, resulting in a healthier lifestyle, in advanced COPD patients.
Study design: Randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blind trial.
Nature and extent of the burden and risks associated with participation, benefit and group relatedness: The nutrient supplement is hypothesized to have beneficial effects on general health because it applies physical and mental health domains. The healthy lifestyle counselling aims to improve medical adherence, to address a healthier lifestyle and to manage weight loss which would contribute to improved general health. Risks and inconveniences are limited to the time investment associated with taking the supplements and measuring days. During the test-days various non-invasive measurements as well as minor invasive blood sampling will be performed. The investigators expect no risk of the nutrient supplementation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity level assessed by measuring step count with accelerometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 3, and 12-14 months and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later
primary_outcome.description: Subjects will wear an activPAL accelerometer for 1 week to assess physical activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in generic health status measured by EuroQol-5 dimensions (EQ-5D)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 3, and 12-14 months and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later
primary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D is a generic classification system used to characterize current health states of patients. It consists of 5 domains (mobility; self-care; usual activity; pain/discomfort; anxiety/depression) and a visual analogue scale (EQ-VAS). The domains have a scale from 1-3 and the VAS-scale from 0-100 in which higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive function measured by the Neuropsychological test automated battery (CANTAB)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will use the Motor Screening Task, Reaction Time Task, Paired Associates Learning, Delayed Matching-to-Sample, Spatial Working Memory and Stop Signal Task. The higher the score on these tasks, the better the cognitive function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Depression Anxiety Stress Scale 21 (DASS-21)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: The DASS-21 measures 3 related states of depression, anxiety and stress. The DASS-21 consists of 21 negative emotional symptoms and subjects will be asked to extent to which have experienced each symptom over the past week, on a 4-point severity/frequency scale. The total score will range from 0-66 in which a higher score means more susceptibility to depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hospital and Anxiety Scale (HADS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: The HADS will allow the investigators to measure domain-specific quality of life. This is a 14-item instrument designed to detect the presence and severity of mild degrees of mood disorder, anxiety and depression in hospital and community setting and outside. Per scale (anxiety and depression) a maximum of 21 points can be scored, in which a higher score means worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cohen's Perceived Stress Scale (PSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: The PSS is a measure of the degree to which situations in one's life are appraised as stressful. Individual scores on the PSS can range from 0 to 40 with higher scores indicating higher perceived stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood pressure after the socially evaluated cold pressure test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The SECPT asks the participant to immerse their right hand up to and including the writs into ice water for a maximum of 3 minutes. Blood pressure will be measured before and after the test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cortisol in the saliva after the socially evaluated cold pressure test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The SECPT asks the participant to immerse their right hand up to and including the writs into ice water for a maximum of 3 minutes. Cortisol in the saliva will be measured before and after the test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hair cortisol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 and 12-14 months and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Cortisol level in hair is a biomarker of chronic stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in lower extremity performance by the short physical performance battery (SPPB)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Three manoeuvres will be performed: the balance test, the gait speed test and the chair stand test. Each individual can score 0-12 points in which a higher score means a better physical performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in muscle strength by measuring handgrip strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Handgrip strength is measured in the dominant hand using a hydraulic grip strength dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in respiratory muscle strength by measuring the inspiratory and expiratory mouth pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: The mouth pressure will be measured using the MicroRPM monitor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in exercise performance by measuring the 6 minute walking distance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will be instructed to walk as fast as possible for 6 minutes. The distance walked during these 6 minutes will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body composition by performing Dual energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA-scan)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Using the DEXA-scan three compartments of the body composition (lean mass, fat mass, bone mass) will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in weight
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Weight will be measured in kg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in height
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Height will be measured in cm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood markers of systemic inflammation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Markers include high-sensitive C-reactive protein, procalcitonin, interleukin-6, interleukin-8 and leucocyte levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood markers of nutritional status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-3 months; 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Markers include vitamin E, vitamin D, poly unsaturated fatty acids, amino acids (tryptophan), and homocysteine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood markers of gut-muscle-brain cross-talk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Markers include tryptophan, kynurenine and kynurenic acid.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fatigue by using the checklist individual strength (CIS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: The CIS is a 20-item self-report questionnaire that measures several aspects of fatigue: fatigue severity, concentration, motivation and physical activity. Individual scores can range from 20-140 in which higher scores mean fatigue problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: Pain will be assessed by the VAS range from 0-100, in which a higher score means more pain experience.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sleep quality by the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: The PSQI is a self-report questionnaire to assess sleep quality. It consists of 19 individual items, creating 7 components that produce one global score (0-21, in which higher scores indicate worse sleep quality).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intestinal fatty acid binding protein (blood) in rest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
secondary_outcome.description: IFABP is a marker for intestinal integrity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intestinal fatty acid binding protein (blood) after the 6MWT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: IFABP is a marker for intestinal integrity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in gut microbiome composition (optional)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Several analysis will be performed after completion of the study. The exact markers of the microbiome will be determined.

other_outcome.measure: Change in the global impacts of COPD on health status using the COPD assessment test (CAT)
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
other_outcome.description: The CAT score ranges from 0-40, in which a higher score means worse outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Change in health status using the Clinical COPD questionnaire (CCQ)
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
other_outcome.description: The CCQ is a 10-item questionnaire and individual scores range from 0-6 in which a higher score means worse health status

other_outcome.measure: Change in breathlessness using the medical research council (MRC-scale)
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
other_outcome.description: The MRC-scale ranges from 0-5 in which a higher score means more breathlessness.

other_outcome.measure: Change in medication use by self-report
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-12 months; and in case of hospitalization for COPD exacerbation within one week after discharge and 4 weeks later.
other_outcome.description: All medications used by participants will be reported to determine difference in medication use between groups.

other_outcome.description: Comorbidities will be extracted from the medical history
